page.title: 10Houses in Woodchurch
page.content: The first houses were very simple in design - consisting of wood and natural materials. They used branches to form a skeleton and twigs were woven in between. A coating of clay and straw was used to fill the spaces, and large stones were used round the base to give extra strength. The Wealden Hall type house{(Hendon {Place)}built in the 14th and 15th C, was a timber structure on 2 floors. The main Hall was the height of the house and was used for various purposes. In it was the fire and as there were no chimneys, the smoke billowed round and found its way out of slits at roof level.In the 17th C, people wanted more privacy, so the "hall" disappeared. The smoke from the fire now went up a chimney and the roof space was used for accommodation, as in the{Old School House,Woodchurch.
